description: Bilateral flows of remittances between pairs of countries, 2010-2012
source: World Bank Migration and Remittances Factbook (estimates of bilateral remittance flows)
calculation: This dataset uses OECD DAC deflators for countries included in their deflators dataset and deflators calculated from IMF WEO GDP figures for all other countries. BASE YEAR = 2012

description: Bilateral flows of humanitarian assistance between countries, 2000-2012
Breakdown of financing types for FDI in developing countries, or a subset of developing countries (based on data availability).
source:
Sources vary by country: 
Denmark: Denmark NationalBank (breakdown data only available for Africa, Turkey, Mexico, Argentina, Brazil, India, China, Malaysia and Thailand)
France: Banque de France statistics (data are for the 43 developing countries with data on modalities from the Banque de France, representing around 97% of total investment in developing countries)
Germany: Deutche Bundesbank (data are for the 22 developing countries with data on modalities from the Deutche Bundesbank, representing around 58% of total investment in developing countries)
United Kingdom: Office of National Statistics (data are for investment in Africa, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Mexico, Panama, China, India, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand)
United States: Bureau of Economic Affairs (data are based on regional totals, with figures for investment in developed countries subtracted where available - totals may not exactly match total investment figures presented elsewhere)
calculation: This dataset uses OECD DAC deflators for countries included in their deflators dataset and deflators calculated from IMF WEO GDP figures for all other countries. BASE YEAR = 2012

description: Outflows of profits on FDI leaving the country
calculation: This dataset uses OECD DAC deflators for countries included in their deflators dataset and deflators calculated from IMF WEO GDP figures for all other countries. BASE YEAR = 2012

description: Estimates of illicit finance outflows
calculation:
Estimates use GFI's Hot Money Narrow (HMN) Method 
This dataset uses OECD DAC deflators for countries included in their deflators dataset and deflators calculated from IMF WEO GDP figures for all other countries. BASE YEAR = 2012

description: Capital repayments on outstanding long term debt
Estimates of trade mispricing outflows
calculation:
Estimates use GFI's Gross Excluding Reversals (GER) Method of estimating trade mispricing flows
This dataset uses OECD DAC deflators for countries included in their deflators dataset and deflators calculated from IMF WEO GDP figures for all other countries. BASE YEAR = 2012

description: Government spending per person, 2011 PPP$, net of general budget support ODA and disbursements on debt to the public sector
source: Development Initiatives, based on IMF WEO, OECD DAC, World Bank
calculation: Calculated from IMF WEO data on government spending as a proportion of GDP. Receipts of general budget support ODA and disbursements on public debt are subtracted from total government spending before dividing by the population, to avoid double counting when comparing with international resource flows.

description: Total government spending, 2012 USD, net of general budget support ODA and disbursements on debt to the public sector
source: Development Initiatives, based on IMF WEO, OECD DAC, World Bank
calculation: Calculated from IMF WEO data on government spending as a proportion of GDP. Receipts of general budget support ODA and disbursements on public debt are subtracted from total government spending to avoid double counting when comparing with international resource flows.

description: Earnings on FDI returning back to the source country
source:
Sources vary by country:
Finland: Bank of Finland Statistics (data only covers earnings on FDI in Africa, Mexico, Brazil, China and Malaysia)
UK: Office of National Statistics (data only covers earnings on FDI in Africa, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Mexico, Panama, China, India, Indonesia, Malaysia, and Thailand)
US: Bureau of Economic Analysis
calculation: This dataset uses OECD DAC deflators for countries included in their deflators dataset and deflators calculated from IMF WEO GDP figures for all other countries. BASE YEAR = 2012

description: Inward humanitarian assistance, 2000-2012
Inward remittances
source: World Bank migration and remittances factbook
calculation: This dataset uses OECD DAC deflators for countries included in their deflators dataset and deflators calculated from IMF WEO GDP figures for all other countries. BASE YEAR = 2012

description: Net inward disbursements on short-term debt
calculation: This dataset uses OECD DAC deflators for countries included in their deflators dataset and deflators calculated from IMF WEO GDP figures for all other countries. BASE YEAR = 2012

description: Net inward disbursements on long-term debt
source: Development Initiatives calculations based on World Bank International Debt Statistics
calculation:
Disbursements on ODA and OOF loans have been subtracted from the official component of long-term debt disbursements. See methodology for details.
This dataset uses OECD DAC deflators for countries included in their deflators dataset and deflators calculated from IMF WEO GDP figures for all other countries. BASE YEAR = 2012

description: Gross ODA disbursements, all donors
Gross disbursements of other official flows, all donors
Net inward portfolio equity
Total international resource flows received
source: Development Initiatives calculations based on numerous sources
calculation: Is the sum of net inflows of FDI, remittances, gross ODA, gross OOFs, portfolio equity, net inflows of short-term debt, long-term debt, humanitarian assistance and peacekeeping. This series aims to estimate gross inflows so negative net inflows are excluded (set to zero). Data on peacekeeping is only available for 2012 and humanitarian assistance (excluding that reported as ODA to the OECD DAC) is only available from 2000-2012.

source: CRS transactions, DI sector grouping, DI Aid bundle grouping

description: Remittances to developing countries by source country
source: Development Initiatives calculations based on World Bank Migration and Remittances Factbook
calculation: This dataset uses OECD DAC deflators for countries included in their deflators dataset and deflators calculated from IMF WEO GDP figures for all other countries. BASE YEAR = 2012. Note that estimates of bilateral remittance flows are only available for 2010-2012
